questions.text: Is there a clearly assigned data owner responsible for the domain's data?
Are roles and responsibilities for data stewardship clearly defined?
Does the domain maintain ownership of both operational and analytical data?
Is the domain accountable for data quality and data lifecycle management?
Are domain teams empowered to make decisions about data modeling and publishing?
Does the domain have sufficient resources (skills, capacity) to own its data?
Does the domain publish data as products with clear documentation and SLAs?
Are data products easy to discover through a central catalog?
Do data products include metadata such as lineage, owners, quality metrics?
Are consumers able to easily understand and use the data products?
Are versioning, changes, and updates to data products managed consistently?
Does the domain collect feedback from consumers to improve data products?
Can the domain independently create and maintain data pipelines?
Does the domain use CI/CD or automated deployment for data products?
Are platform tools intuitive and accessible without deep engineering help?
Is monitoring and alerting of data pipelines automated?
Are there reusable templates or components for pipeline creation?
Does the domain rely minimally on central IT for operational tasks?
Does the domain follow global standards for metadata and documentation?
Are data quality rules automatically enforced?
Are security and privacy controls (e.g., PII masking) applied consistently?
Does the domain participate in federated governance decision-making?
Are compliance and audit requirements built into data processes?
Are governance policies implemented through automation rather than manual work?
